intro: Eschweilera trochiformis, commonly known as the pink-veined tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Amazon Basin, particularly in Brazil, Peru, and Colombia, where it thrives in humid, tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with distinctive pink veins, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
